Package dsa_assignment4

Class CsvFormatter

java.lang.Object
dsa_assignment4.CsvFormatter
public class CsvFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
A very simplified CSV formatter class. This only supports a very limited version of the CSV file format where
  • There must be a column header row and column headers must be non-empty strings that contain only the upper and lower case letters, digits, underscore, space and hyphens
  • Quotes in field values have no special meanings
  • Rows and fields cannot be split over multiple lines or contain line breaks
  • Fields in non-header rows cannot contain comma characters (',') or vertical whitespace characters (newline, carriage return etc.)
  • There is no character escape mechanism supported
  • There is no support for any field separator other than comma (',')
  • All rows in a CSV file must have exactly the same number of fields as the header (even if some are empty)
  • Columns all have type String: no special interpretation is made to treat a string of digits as a number and comparisons between rows based on a particular column always uses only string comparison, never numeric comparisons
The following is an example CSV file that matches these requirements: 
 ID,Name,Mark,Penalty
 1234567,John Smith,87,-3
 1234568,Erik Hasselhoff,43,+4
 1234569,Xiaowei Zhang,93.5,-2

  • Constructor Details

    • CsvFormatter

      public CsvFormatter​(java.lang.String[] headings) throws java.lang.Exception
      Constructs a CsvFormatter object based on an array of column header strings
      Parameters:
      headings - the String array of column headers
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if headings contain any duplicates or if any of the column headers are null, empty or contain any characters other than upper and lower case letters, digits, underscore or space

    • CsvFormatter

      public CsvFormatter​(java.util.Scanner scanner) throws java.lang.Exception
      Constructor that reads the header row from scanner.
      Parameters:
      scanner - An open Scanner object from which the first line is read and interpreted as the header row of a CSV file
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if scanner is not an open Scanner object or from which no further lines can be read or if it does not match the requirements of a CSV header row

  • Method Details

    • getHeaderStrings

      public java.lang.String[] getHeaderStrings()
      // * Return a copy of the header strings
      Returns:
      a copy of the header strings, isolated from the internal class fields

    • getColumnNumber

      public java.lang.Integer getColumnNumber​(java.lang.String name)
      Get the column number of the column with a particular header
      Parameters:
      name - The column header required
      Returns:
      the column number of the column with that header, or null if that name is not one of the column headers

    • readRow

      public java.lang.String[] readRow​(java.util.Scanner scanner) throws java.lang.Exception
      Reads and returns a CSV row from an open scanner
      Parameters:
      scanner - The open scanner to read from
      Returns:
      The array of strings which form the fields of the row, or null if there are no more rows to read in the file
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if scanner is not an open Scanner object or from which no further lines can be read or if the row does not have the same number of fields as the header

    • writeRow

      public void writeRow​(java.io.PrintWriter writer, java.lang.String[] row) throws java.lang.Exception
      Write a row to a CSV file
      Parameters:
      writer - The open PrintWriter through which to write the row
      row - The row to write
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if writer or row is null or the row does not match the CSV requirements

    • writeHeader

      public void writeHeader​(java.io.PrintWriter writer) throws java.lang.Exception
      Write the header to a CSV file
      Parameters:
      writer - The open PrintWriter through which to write the header
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if writer is null
